result.execSummary:
The defendant Angaleena N. Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angaleena N. Guzman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angaleena N. Guzman was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 60 days to pay or payment plan with the Clerk of Court if unable to pay in 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

15CM175 and 16CM121.  Defendant Angaleena N. Guzman in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states that the parties have an agreement in 15CM175 for def's plea to count 2/possession of drug paraphernalia for dismissal of count 1/possession of THC.  Def pleads no contest.  Colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  costs.  60 dtp.  Count 1 dismissed.

16CM121 - initial appearance conducted.  Formal reading waived.  Charges and possible max. penalties stated.  NG entered.  Status requested and set.
